descript.abstract: U.S. Large Area Landmarks represents common landmark areas in the United States.The landmark area types (and examples or definitions of what may exist within each type) are military territories (installations, barracks, practice grounds, and roads), hospitals (buildings, roads, parking, and green areas), educational institutions (buildings, roads, parking, and green areas), shopping centers (buildings with individual shops, parking, and related facilities), industrial areas (artificial cover with buildings), amusement parks (areas for public entertainment with buildings, green areas, related facilities, and parking), stadiums (athletic or sports grounds with tiers of seats for spectators and parking), golf courses (areas used to play golf and facilities such as buildings and parking), and cemeteries (areas dedicated for the interment of human remains).
descript.purpose: U.S. Large Area Landmarks provides thousands of common landmark areas within the United States. The areas can be used as a cultural layer at local and regional levels. Most landmarks are named.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the Land Use Areas dataset from TomTom MultiNet North America. Removed all fields except FEATTYP and NAME. Renamed field FEATTYP to MNFC. Selected the large area landmark features. Added field FEATTYPE and copied its values from MultiNet FEATTYP descriptions. Added field SQMI and calculated its values.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent common landmark areas in the United States including military territories; hospital grounds; educational institution grounds comprising of primary and secondary schools, universities, and colleges; shopping center grounds; industrial areas; amusement park grounds; stadium grounds; golf course grounds; and cemetery grounds.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The official name of the large area landmark.
The feature type description of the large area landmark.
The MultiNet feature type code of the large area landmark.
The area of the large area landmark in square miles using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.
